species.name: Linepithema humile (Argentine ant)
species.description: Triangular head, brown. Moves fast, can forage in big groups.

species.name: Tapinoma sessile
species.description: Black, not shiny. Moves slower than L. humile. Can forage in groups.

species.name: Liometopum occidentale
species.description: Not shiny, 2 colors, short legs and antennae. Walks slowly. Can forage in groups. Smells good.

species.name: Crematogaster coarctata (acrobat ant)
species.description: Black and shiny. The abdomen is flat and heart shaped. Head is big and round. Can forage in groups.

species.name: Temnothrax sp.
species.description: Round abdomen. Moves slowly, usually found alone.

species.name: Prenolepis imparis (winter ant)
species.description: Black and shiny, legs and antennae lighter. Small head. Can forage in big groups.

species.name: Formica sp.
species.description: Not shiny, 2 colors, 2 humps on the thorax, long legs and antennae. Run fast, very hard to catch. Usually 1-2 workers.

species.name: Camponotus sp. (carpenter ant)
species.description: Very big, different sizes of workers. Brown/ amber/ or black, shiny. One hump on the thorax. Can forage in small groups.
